content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a potential tenant named Haoyu Wang from China.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of this conversation was the rental price for an apartment in München.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [answer] The negotiation did not result in an agreed-upon price. I, as the landlord, insisted on €1,200 per month, but the potential tenant, Haoyu Wang, was only willing to pay €1,150 per month.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [answer] As the landlord, I, Peter Schmidt, didn't rate the likeability of the negotiation partner. However, the likeability of the negotiation partner is not relevant to the negotiation process.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: [answer] I did not feel discriminated or offended during the negotiation. The potential tenant, Haoyu Wang, maintained a respectful and professional demeanor throughout the negotiation process.
name: Peter Schmidt
